name: Data Leakage Protection Analyst \ Security officer (IT)
description:
International Oil & Gas engineering company is searching for experienced Data Leakage Protection Analyst \ Security officer for DLP software management and operations. This position requires deep understanding of security best practices and application for corporate workflows in all office locations around the world, development of global monitoring criteria and policies for protecting against internal and externals risks. Providing monitoring reports to management and investigation policy violations. It shall be noted that other security related tasks would include CCTV and biometric software (ZKTeco server) management for means of attendance control.

Job Functions, Responsibilities & Authorities

  • Deep learning\understanding of all Pirecare Group production and operation workflows
  • Development of global user activity monitoring policies in regard of granted\forbidden actions as per departments workflows.
  • DLP Remediation and Policy Management. Creation of Regular Expressions for activity monitoring.
  • Conducting internal and external penetration tests of information systems using commercial and open source exploitation tools.
  • Conducting internal configuration and vulnerability assessments of information systems using commercial and open source assessment tools.
  • Conducting wireless security assessments.
  • Conducting web and mobile application penetration tests.
  • Documenting and analyzing firewall configurations and rule-sets.
  • Engaging in security research to remain current on vulnerabilities and testing tools.
  • Creating detailed, professional reports that clearly reveals vulnerabilities, mitigation strategies, and remediation steps.

Qualifications/Skills/Experience:

  • Fluent or Native English language – is a must.
  • University degree with a technical major, such as engineering, computer or other technical study.
  • Be familiar with corporate network architecture technologies and protocols, Windows and Linux operating systems, routing, web technologies and protocols, firewall configuration and ruleset maintenance
  • 2+ Years of DLP software experience in an enterprise environment including implementation and management of DLP programs.
  • Some experience in IT administration / In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory, networking and TCP/IP.
  • Experience with commercial and open source vulnerability / penetration testing tools.
  • Experience with Group Policy Management & Local Security Policies.
  • Experience developing custom exploit code and scripts.
  • One or more up to date security certifications is a big advantage (e.g. CISSP, OSCP, GSEC, GPEN, GCFW, GWAPT, GAWN).
  • The ability to work on multiple projects concurrently and be committed to providing exemplary customer service.
  • Strong technical writing and presentation skills.
  • Comfortable working in a team environment and having your work be subject to a peer review process.
  • Exposure and experience with general data protection and cryptographic implementations at the application and file levels.
  • And of course, patience, flexibility and a sense of humor is a must!
  • Full time in the office in Ekaterinburg or Kolomna. Full-time remote work is possible.
